list.title: Question 1
list.content:
Expand(2x+1)4(2x + 1)^4(2x+1)4in descending powers ofxxxand simplify your
answer.

list.title: Question 2
list.content:
Expand(2x−3)4(2x - 3)^4(2x−3)4in descending powers ofxxxand simplify your
answer.

list.title: Question 3
list.content: Consider the expansion of(2x−1)9(2x-1)^9(2x−1)9.Write down the number of terms in this expansion.[1]Find the coefficient of the term inx2x^2x2.[5]

list.title: Question 4
list.content: Consider the expansion of(x−3)8(x-3)^8(x−3)8.Write down the number of terms in this expansion.[1]Find the coefficient of the term inx6x^6x6.[4]

list.title: Question 5
list.content: The coefficient of the variablex5x^5x5in the expansion of(x+2a)8(x+2a)^8(x+2a)8, wherea∈Ra\in \mathbb{R}a∈R, is565656.Find the value ofaaa.

list.title: Question 6
list.content:
Show that(2n−1)3+(2n+1)3=16n3+12n(2n-1)^3 + (2n+1)^3 = 16n^3+12n(2n−1)3+(2n+1)3=16n3+12nforn∈Zn \in \mathbb{Z}n∈Z.[3]Hence, or otherwise, prove that the sum of the cubes of any two
consecutive odd integers is divisible by four.[3]

list.title: Question 7
list.content:
The third term, in descending powers ofxxx, in the expansion of(x+p)8(x+p)^8(x+p)8is252x6252x^6252x6. Find the
possible values ofppp.

list.title: Question 8
list.content: In the expansion of(a+bx)6(a+bx)^6(a+bx)6, the coefficient of thex3x^3x3term is−2-2−2times the coefficient of thex4x^4x4term.Determine the value ofab\displaystyle \frac{a}{b}ba​.

list.title: Question 9
list.content: Consider the expansion of(x22+ax)6\left(\dfrac{x^2}{2} + \dfrac{a}{x}\right)^6(2x2​+xa​)6. The constant term is960960960.Find the possible values ofaaa.

list.title: Question 10
list.content: Consider the expansion of(x+a)7bx\dfrac{(x+a)^7}{bx}bx(x+a)7​, wherea>0a > 0a>0. The coefficient of the term inx5x^5x5is222, and the coefficient of the term inx3x^3x3is169016901690.Find the value ofaaaand the value ofbbb.

list.title: Question 11
list.content: In the expansion ofpx2(5+px)8px^2(5 + px)^8px2(5+px)8, the coefficient of the term inx6x^6x6is340234023402. Find the value ofppp.

list.title: Question 12
list.content: Consider the expansion of(3x+px)8\bigg(3x + \dfrac{p}{x}\bigg)^8(3x+xp​)8, wherep>0p > 0p>0. The coefficient of the terminx4x^4x4is equal to the coefficient of the term inx6x^6x6. Findppp.

list.title: Question 13
list.content:
Letf(x)=(x2+a)5f(x) = (x^2 + a)^5f(x)=(x2+a)5.In the expansion of the derivative,f′(x)f'(x)f′(x), the coefficient of the term
inx5x^5x5is960960960. Find the possible values ofaaa.

list.title: Question 14
list.content:
Consider the expansion of(2x6+x2q)10\bigg(2x^6+\dfrac{x^2}{q}\bigg)^{10}(2x6+qx2​)10,q≠0q \neq 0q=0. The coefficient of the terminx40x^{40}x40is twelve times the coefficient of the term inx36x^{36}x36.
Findqqq.
list.markScheme:
Using the binomial theorem, we have(2x6+x2q)10=∑k=010(10k)[2x6]10−k[x2q]k=∑k=010(10k)[210−kq−k][x60−4k]\begin{aligned}
\hspace{2.5em} \bigg(2x^6+\dfrac{x^2}{q}\bigg)^{10} &= \sum_{k=0}^{10} \binom{10}{k} \big[2x^6\big]^{10-k}\bigg[\dfrac{x^2}{q}\bigg]^k \\[3pt]
&= \sum_{k=0}^{10} \binom{10}{k} \big[2^{10-k}q^{-k}\big]\big[x^{60-4k}\big] \\
\end{aligned}(2x6+qx2​)10​=k=0∑10​(k10​)[2x6]10−k[qx2​]k=k=0∑10​(k10​)[210−kq−k][x60−4k]​Hence we get[coefficient of the term inx40]=12[coefficient of the term inx36](105)[210−5q−5]=12(106)[210−6q−6]252[25q−5]=12(210)[24q−6]\begin{aligned}
\big[\text{coefficient of the term in $x^{40}$}\big] &= 12\big[\text{coefficient of the term in $x^{36}$}\big] \hspace{2.8em} \\[6pt]
\binom{10}{5}\big[2^{10-5}q^{-5}\big] &= 12\binom{10}{6}\big[2^{10-6}q^{-6}\big] \\[6pt]
252\big[2^5q^{-5}\big] &= 12(210)\big[2^4q^{-6}\big] \\
\end{aligned}[coefficient of the term inx40](510​)[210−5q−5]252[25q−5]​=12[coefficient of the term inx36]=12(610​)[210−6q−6]=12(210)[24q−6]​q=5[by using G.D.C.]\hspace{6.9em} \answer{q = 5} \hspace{3em} [\text{by using G.D.C.}]q=5​[by using G.D.C.]

list.title: Question 15
list.content: In the expansion ofx(2x+1)nx(2x + 1)^nx(2x+1)n, the coefficient of the term inx3x^3x3is20n20n20n, wheren∈Z+n \in \mathbb{Z}^+n∈Z+. Findnnn.
list.markScheme:
Using the binomial theorem, we have20nx3=x(n2)[1n−2][(2x)2](1)\begin{aligned}
20nx^3 &= x\binom{n}{2}\big[1^{n-2}\big]\big[(2x)^2\big] \qref{(1)}\end{aligned}20nx3​=x(2n​)[1n−2][(2x)2](1)​Hence, solving the equation(1)(1)(1)fornnn, we get20nx3=x[n!2!(n−2)!][4x2]20nx3=[n(n−1)2][4x3]10n=n(n−1)0=n(n−11)\begin{aligned}
20nx^3 &= x\bigg[\dfrac{n!}{2!(n-2)!}\bigg]\big[4x^2\big] \hspace{0.3em} \\[6pt]
20nx^3 &= \bigg[\dfrac{n(n-1)}{2}\bigg]\big[4x^3\big] \\[12pt]
10n &= n(n-1) \\[18pt]
0 &= n(n - 11) \\
\end{aligned}20nx320nx310n0​=x[2!(n−2)!n!​][4x2]=[2n(n−1)​][4x3]=n(n−1)=n(n−11)​n=11\answer{n =11} \hspace{5.7em}n=11​

list.title: Question 16
list.content: In the expansion of(2x+1)n(2x + 1)^n(2x+1)n, the coefficient of the term inx2x^2x2is40n40n40n, wheren∈Z+n \in \mathbb{Z}^+n∈Z+. Findnnn.
list.markScheme:
Using the binomial theorem, we have40nx2=(n2)[1n−2][(2x)2](1)\begin{aligned}
40nx^2 &= \binom{n}{2}\big[1^{n-2}\big]\big[(2x)^2\big] \qref{(1)}\end{aligned}40nx2​=(2n​)[1n−2][(2x)2](1)​Hence, solving the equation(1)(1)(1)fornnn, we get40nx2=[n!2!(n−2)!][4x2]40n=[n(n−1)2][4]20n=n(n−1)0=n(n−21)\begin{aligned}
40nx^2 &= \bigg[\dfrac{n!}{2!(n-2)!}\bigg]\big[4x^2\big] \hspace{0.3em} \\[6pt]
40n &= \bigg[\dfrac{n(n-1)}{2}\bigg]\big[4\big] \\[12pt]
20n &= n(n-1) \\[18pt]
0 &= n(n - 21) \\
\end{aligned}40nx240n20n0​=[2!(n−2)!n!​][4x2]=[2n(n−1)​][4]=n(n−1)=n(n−21)​n=21\answer{n =21} \hspace{5.1em}n=21​

list.title: Question 19
Question 20
list.content:
Given that(1+x)3(1+px)4=1+qx+93x2+⋯+p4x7(1 + x)^3(1 + px)^4 = 1 + qx + 93x^2 + \dots + p^4x^7(1+x)3(1+px)4=1+qx+93x2+⋯+p4x7, find

list.title: Question 21
list.content:
Write down the quadratic expression3x2+5x−23x^2 + 5x - 23x2+5x−2in the form(ax−b)(x+c)(ax-b)(x+c)(ax−b)(x+c).[2]Hence, or otherwise, find the coefficient of the term inx9x^9x9in
the expansionof(3x2+5x−2)5(3x^2+5x-2)^5(3x2+5x−2)5.[5]
